title: SadGoodbye
author: SadGoodbye
content: I have so many questions in mind concerning crypto and I want to ask if this forum search engine can lead me to some of the questions, is the search engine on the right side of the screen that capable? I am new on here and I need some guidance, hope I am welcomed üôá thank you.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: If you can search properly, you are likely to get all the answers you need from this forum. Remember that this forum is the heaven for cryptocurrency information, specially if they are technical aspects.You can learn how to use the search option properly here-[Guide] Searching effectivelyAlso, if you have any questions going through in your mind, don't hesitate to create a thread here after having a search.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: SadGoodbye on September 27, 2022, 04:09:20 PMI have so many questions in mind concerning crypto and I want to ask if this forum search engine can lead me to some of the questions, is the search engine on the right side of the screen that capable? I am new on here and I need some guidance, hope I am welcomed üôá thank you. Welcome.Instead of the forum search function, you can also use the google search engine. Just add "site:bitcointalk.org" to google search to limit the results to bitcointalk.org.Here is an example that you can try:Quote from: mk4 on July 03, 2022, 02:46:52 PMCode:site:bitcointalk.org what is "crypto" -dogehttps://support.google.com/websearch/answer/2466433?hl=en

comments.author: alik111
comments.body: You are always welcome in this forum and hope you start a good crypto journey.And you can easily learn about any crypto related topic in this Beginners section or by using forum search option. Because most of the cases are already discussed in this forum.

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.created_time: September 27, 2022, 06:31:01 PMLast edit: September 27, 2022, 06:59:56 PM by Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Hey, welcome on board but, I don't think it was necessary for you to make two different topics.There would have been a way to make a topic to engulf all the points you separated. Take note of that.We have alot of pinned post on different boards of the forum. Do yourself some good to goggle around each board -- most especially -- meta and the "beginners &help" which is prolly the same board we're talking.Take note of the PROs and CONs and stick around. You'll learn more as time fades. See you out thereCheersSandra üë©‚Äçü¶±

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: SadGoodbye on September 27, 2022, 04:09:20 PMI have so many questions in mind concerning crypto and I want to ask if this forum search engine can lead me to some of the questions, is the search engine on the right side of the screen that capable? I am new on here and I need some guidance, hope I am welcomed üôá thank you. You are welcome for sure but have you tried to use the search function at all? I challenge you to try the search first, and only after that, if you are not satisfied with what you found, ask here.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.created_time: September 27, 2022, 06:49:19 PMLast edit: December 16, 2023, 06:49:43 PM by Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: SadGoodbye on September 27, 2022, 04:09:20 PMI have so many questions in mind concerning crypto and I want to ask if this forum search engine can lead me to some of the questions, is the search engine on the right side of the screen that capable? I am new on here and I need some guidance, hope I am welcomed üôá thank you. First, I would like to say welcome to the forum, i hope you find what you are looking for, as well as have a wonderful stay here.Concerning your query, based on my experience using the forum's search engine, I wouldn't guarantee it's effectiveness at all times, I mean there are times you search for something, and you end up with "No Results Found" even when that thing is something that's been discussed several times here.But here is what I do most times, I use Google search to find topics/discussions on this forum.For example, If I want to find discussions on this forum on buying bitcoin with credit card, I simply open Google search and type...Code:Bitcointalk buying bitcoin with credit cardAnd hit the search button, 90 percent of the result you will be getting are gonna be discussions on this forum partaining to the searched keywords.Example is the screenshot below...It's works, just make sure you type "Bitcointalk" first before typing what you are searching for.

comments.author: Oceat
comments.body: Just try it out to see what you've been trying to search you'll never know if you won't try. Let yourself explore the forum for a moment although it quite take some time to get used to the forum but it's worth it. And good luck with your journey to the crypto space, you did make the right choice to choose this forum for your crypto journey.Please pay attention to the stickies on every board of this forum you will find some useful information there.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Welcome to the forum and I would say congratulations because this is a big win for you in your search for better Crypto-currency knowledge. You already did well so far by the fact you pointed out that this is your starting point. Unlearn any funny thing you have already heard about Crypto-currency given out hidden wealth, that's totally BS.First approach for you is to understand this forum you joined, and advice is for you to pay attention you all board of your interest but mainly this one and the meta board for a while. Pinned messages are always there for your use. Welcome once again.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Welcome! I suggest you use this[1] advance search feature of the forum instead of using the search feature on the right side of this page. Well, the advance one also suggest to use google search for more accurate results, so uncle google is really your ¬†helpful body even searching stuff about the forum.Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on September 27, 2022, 06:49:19 PMIt's works, just make sure you type "Bitcointalk" first before typing what you are searching for. It still work regardless you put "bitcointalk" keyword in first or in the last, but not all results are from bitcointalk.For advance searching[2] you can use "your keywords site:bitcointalk.org" as this will find the website's sitemap, in simple words every result came from the site you input. [1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=search[2] https://superpctricks.com/googles-advanced-searching-tricks/

comments.author: Gallar
comments.body: all you have to do is keep looking for knowledge or information about crypto, the basics of trading and investingbecause it will be very useful for you,if you really start investing or trading in crypto,and take your time to view or read the articles on this forum, at least one hour,because that way your information and knowledge will continue to grow.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: I would say it's better for you to use google search instead of in forum search engine since it's suck lol. If you search a long sentence and use the search engine, you will many thread that doesn't related with the sentence. It's only good to search about particular word or phrase, not in sentence. Since your crypto journey begins today, I advice to avoid the whole shitcoins aka crypto in general and only focus on Bitcoin. This because there's many scams on crypto that would make you get scammed.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: SadGoodbye on September 27, 2022, 04:09:20 PMI have so many questions in mind concerning crypto and I want to ask if this forum search engine can lead me to some of the questions, is the search engine on the right side of the screen that capable? I am new on here and I need some guidance, hope I am welcomed üôá thank you. You are welcomed and I have gone through comments in your posy, they have proffered answers to your questions ranging from how to effectively search in the forum to using Google search but prefixing bitcointalk to your search to give you a more filtered result.Then I have to add, that before you start learning about crypto and get carried away, try to read the Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ. Get aware of the does and don'ts of the forum in order to have a smooth stay, else you could be banned for plagiarism and related offences.

comments.author: Finestream
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on September 27, 2022, 04:43:32 PMIf you can search properly, you are likely to get all the answers you need from this forum. Remember that this forum is the heaven for cryptocurrency information, specially if they are technical aspects.You can learn how to use the search option properly here-[Guide] Searching effectivelyAlso, if you have any questions going through in your mind, don't hesitate to create a thread here after having a search. Right. Never hesitate to make a thread so that all your questions and doubts will end finally answered and you won‚Äôt be keeping doing mistakes later on. Whatever your mind thinks that you are not sure of, just put it in the search engine and you will gain a lot of valid answers that will be very helpful in your crypto journey. But always make sure that your questions¬† are also relevant to crypto so you will also receive relevant answers.

comments.author: BlueCrown1978
comments.body: As a beginner, I can advise you to pay attention to the EyesFi project. What is the project? EyesFi launches the ‚ÄúLike2Earn‚Äù model. It has a curation-based reward mechanism and decided to integrate a GameFi dimension into its ecosystem. Users who want to participate must have NFT glasses in order to curate or like the NFTs they believe are valuable. The greater the future value of the curated NFT, the more token rewards users will receive. Under the influence of incentives, users are more inclined to make wise choices. As a result, EyesFi intends to create a more efficient value discovery platform with the assistance of all participants and contributors. For independent study, I leave links to the project:Website: https://www.eyesfi.xyz/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/EyesFi_xyzDiscord: https://discord.com/invite/eyesfi

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: The forum is full of loads of information all you have to do is to search, and you will find answers to your underlined questions, and if in any case, you don't get the answers you are free to create a thread in the right section with your questions and believe me you will get all the answers you seek from others who are knowledgeable in that direction.This forum is full of competent members who have built knowledge and experience that can help answer most questions all you have to do is be ready to read.

comments.author: erep
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on September 27, 2022, 04:50:07 PMHere is an example that you can try:Quote from: mk4 on July 03, 2022, 02:46:52 PMCode:site:bitcointalk.org what is "crypto" -dogehttps://support.google.com/websearch/answer/2466433?hl=enThanks buddy, I always use the above search code to find something important in forums on google search engine, but if you want to find a specific keyword then it's more effective to use ninjastic for precise and fast search will be found from every thread of the board.

comments.author: Russlenat
comments.body: Quote from: SadGoodbye on September 27, 2022, 04:09:20 PMI have so many questions in mind concerning crypto and I want to ask if this forum search engine can lead me to some of the questions, is the search engine on the right side of the screen that capable? I am new on here and I need some guidance, hope I am welcomed üôá thank you.  If you have some questions, then don‚Äôt hesitate to raise it to the forum by making a thread, and expect good answers from the other members. That way, you will receive clear answers to your questions. Or you can just simply use the search engine and find some direct answers. Also, take time to read the forum especially in its beginner‚Äôs section, it will help you a lot. And when you have doubts in your mind, always DYOR so you can gain knowledge and develop your own skills in the forum.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: I put it to you that as you are willing to use the search option both here in the forum and on Google to search for materials regarding cryptocurrency you should also be willing and prepared to actually read through those materials and not merely skim through them. There are a lot of materials on cryptocurrency currently and the ones you may end up going through maybe may be very huge and extensive even more than what you have bargained to read so you must prepare your mind from the start. This new path that you have chosen to thread requires a lot of commitments hard work, you should be ready.

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: Almost all the questions you want to ask have already been answered here, this forum is where you get all the information about Crypto. The information shared here comes from credible and trusted sources, you can also learn directly here to increase your knowledge about crypto.Remember, never be lazy to read. You will not find anything here if you are lazy to read.
